meanings.definition: Lungis (noun): a traditional garment worn in South and Southeast Asia, typically a rectangular piece of cloth wrapped around the waist and legs.
meanings.sent1: In the hot weather, many people in South Asia wear lungis for comfort.
meanings.sent2: My grandfather always wears a lungi around the house.
meanings.sent3: When the wind blew, it lifted his lungi like a sail!
meanings.sent4: The lungi was a colorful flag fluttering in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The lungi's soft fabric felt like a gentle hug around his waist.

meanings.definition: Lungis (verb): the act of wearing or wrapping oneself in a lungi.
meanings.sent1: He lungis every morning before starting his day.
meanings.sent2: She lungis gracefully, wrapping the cloth around her waist.
meanings.sent3: I lungis like a pro, never needing help to get it right.
meanings.sent4: The way he lungis shows his deep connection to his culture.
meanings.sent5: Lungising in the traditional style made her feel connected to her roots.
